div.p: This page provides a list of the FHIR artifacts defined as part of this implementation guide.
{% capture grouping_desc %}These define constraints on FHIR resources for systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}A summary of the ART medication being taken by an HIV patient{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}A patient that may be diagnosed with HIV, may have a viral load lab, and may be virally suppressed.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}HIV status reported after applying the HIV testing algorithm. No single HIV test can provide an HIV-positive diagnosis. {% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The type of key population that the client is included in{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Reason for HIV viral load test{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Whether the client is ART naive or is restarting ART{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Estimated Age of Patient if date of birth is unavailable{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

td.a: Reason for HIV viral load test

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Whether the viral load is being tested for routine monitoring on a set schedule or for targeted monitoring for suspected treatment failure{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define sets of codes used by systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define new code systems used by systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}
